Rektor I UIN Sunan Gunung Djati Bandung: Terjemahan Alquran Berpendekatan Puitis Sastra Sunda Tidaklah Mengapa
05 Nov 2019, 05:06 by Sarnapi
BANDUNG, (PR).- Terjemahan Alquran selama ini terkesan kaku dan tidak berkembang sehingga kehadiran buku terjemahan puitis Alquran disambut baik.
Apalagi buku tersebut membedah terjemahan Alquran dengan pendekatan sastra Sunda yakni dangding dan pupujian yang hidup di tengah masyarakat Sunda.
Hal itu dikatakan Wakil Rektor I UIN Sunan Gunung Djati Bandung Rosihon Anwar saat bedah buku terjemahan puitis Alquran karya Jajang A Rohmana. Acara tersebut digelar di aula Kopertis Jabar dan Banten, Selasa 5 November 2019.
"Terjemahan Alquran dengan pendekatan puitis apalagi dengan sastra Sunda tidaklah mengapa," ujarnya.
Hal itu berbeda apabila bacaan ayat-ayat Alquran dibawakan dengan sastra daerah seperti yang pernah dilakukan saat peringatan hari besar Islam di Istana Negara.
"Kalau buku karya Jajang A Rohmana ini sebatas terjemahan Alquran yang disajikan dengan gaya dangding dan pupujian," katanya.
Penulis buku terjemahan puitis Alquran, Jajang A Rohaman menyatakan, ide awal penulisan buku itu muncul karena dia merasa sebagai orang kampung di daerah Subang.
"Setiap dini hari pukul 3.00 terdengar pupujian dari masjid dekat rumah. Misalnya, eling eling musliminm muslimat, dan seterusnya," ucap dosen Ilmu Alquran dan Tafsir UIN Sunan Gunung Djati itu.
Dia mencontohkan dangding terjemahan surat Al Ashr yaitu, "Demi wanci. Satemena jalma aya Dina rugi. Anging nu ariman, anging nu saroleh nu silih wasiatan Dina jalan bebenaran. Silih wasiatan dina jalan kesabaran."
"Sebenarnya, para pendahulu kita seperti pujangga dan budayawan Sunda seperti Wiranata Kusumah danÂ  Hidayat Suryalaga sudah membuat dangding terjemahan Alquran dengan bahasa Sunda. Ibu Tini Kartini juga mengumpulkan ribuan pupujian yang ada di masyarakat," katanya.
Jajang A Rohmana mengatakan, dangding merupakan puisi yang dinyanyikan dengan netrum yang sudah ditentukan.
"Seperti pupuh sinom dan kinanti. Tentu harus ada aturan dalam membuat dangding sebab tak boleh melenceng dari isi ayat Alquran," ujarnya.***

Chancellor I of UIN Sunan Gunung Djati Bandung: Translation of the Koran with a Poetic Approach Sundanese Literature is not Why
05 Nov 2019, 05:06 by Sarnapi
BANDUNG, (PR) .- Translation of the Koran so far seems stiff and does not develop so that the presence of a poetic translation book of the Koran is welcomed.
Moreover, the book dissects the translation of the Koran with a Sundanese literary approach namely dangding and praise that lives in the middle of Sundanese society.
That was said by Vice Chancellor I of UIN Sunan Gunung Djati Bandung Rosihon Anwar during a review of the poetic translation of the Koran by Jajang A Rohmana. The event was held in the West Java and Banten Kopertis hall on Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
"Translation of the Koran with a poetic approach especially with Sundanese literature is not why," he said.
It was different if the reading of the verses of the Koran was delivered with regional literature as was done during the commemoration of the Islamic holidays at the State Palace.
"If the book by Jajang A Rohmana is limited to the translation of the Koran which is presented in the style of dangding and praise," he said.
The author of the poetic translation of the Koran, Jajang A Rohaman stated, the initial idea of writing the book came up because he felt as a villager in the Subang area.
"Every morning at 3.00 there is praise from the mosque near the house. For example, the Muslim Muslim Community, and so on," said the lecturer of Alquran Science and Interpretation of UIN Sunan Gunung Djati.
He gave an example of the translation of the Al Ashr letter, namely, "For the sake of wanci. Satemena jalma I Dina loss. Anging nu ariman, anging nu saroleh nu alternates the will of Dina the way of truth. Choose the will of dina patience."
"Actually, our predecessors such as Sundanese poets and cultural figures such as Wiranata Kusumah and Hidayat Suryalaga have made a translation of the Koran translation in Sundanese. Ibu Tini Kartini also collected thousands of praises in the community," he said.
Jajang A Rohmana said, dangding is a poem sung with a determined netrum.
"Like the sinom and kinanti poems. Of course there must be rules in making dangding because they cannot deviate from the contents of the Qur'anic verse," he said. ***
